ScrapperBlaster.Utility
Class Vector2D

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.geom.Point2D
      java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double
          ScrapperBlaster.Utility.Vector2D
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class Vector2D
extends Point2D.Double

A vector class with most common operations. A vector is a magnitude and a direction, but only relative to some other object acting as the origin.

Author:
Christopher Sheaf
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

add

public void add(Vector2D otherVector)
Adds a second vector to this vector, mutably.

Parameters:
otherVector - The second vector whose value will be added to this vector's.

dotProduct

public static double dotProduct(Vector2D vectorA,
                                Vector2D vectorB)
Returns the dot product of a pair of vectors.

draw

public void draw(Graphics canvas,
                 int xCoord,
                 int yCoord)
Given an origin and Graphics surface to draw on, draws this vector as a line relative to the origin.

Parameters:
canvas - The surface that this vector will be drawn on.
xCoord - The x-coordinate of the origin to which this vector will be drawn relative to.
yCoord - The y-coordinate of the origin to which this vector will be drawn relative to.

draw

public void draw(Graphics canvas,
                 Point2D.Double origin)
Given an origin and Graphics surface to draw on, draws this vector as a line relative to the origin.

Parameters:
canvas - The surface that this vector will be drawn on.
origin - The origin coordinate pair to which this vector will be drawn relative to.

normalize

public static Vector2D normalize(Vector2D vector)
Given a vector, creates from it a new unit vector, (where the magnitude is exactly 1) but whose direction remains unchanged.

Parameters:
vector - The vector from which the new unit vector will be modelled.

projectAOntoB

public static Vector2D projectAOntoB(Vector2D vectorA,
                                     Vector2D vectorB)
Returns a new vector that is the length of vectorA, in vectorB's direction. Can be thought of as the "shadow" vectorA casts on vectorB with a light source perpendicular to vectorB.

Parameters:
vectorA - The vector being projected.
vectorB - The vector being projected upon.

subtract

public void subtract(Vector2D otherVector)
Subtracts a second vector to this vector, mutably.

Parameters:
otherVector - The second vector whose value will be subtracted from this vector's.
